review_title: Great community college for studying and working part-time
job_title: Federal Work Study in Rock Springs, WY
pros: Personable professors and great studying atmosphere
cons: Very rural area and little to do outside
There is a lot of turmoil in the ranks.
Tough boss. Was very harsh at times

job_title: Academic Tutor in Rock Springs, WY
pros:
-Seeing people grasp concepts and academically succeed
-Flexible hours and relaxed environment
-Coincides with being a student

The Western Wyoming Community College staff and employees have been great to work with and for.  I teach remotely and often need to communicate via email to various members of the the on-site staff.  Responses are fast, and the support from the organization has been great no matter what the need has been.  One of the best employers I have had over my 20 years of experience in the working world.
cons: Classes must be built to be deployed for release date, but the classes only go if the threshold is met for the minimum number of students.  (It has only happened once to me.) This is more indicative of on-line classes in general and not the institution as a whole.

job_title: Associate Professor in Rock Springs, WY
pros: Great sense of community. Very helpful staff and faculty. Generous pay for full-time professors. Route to a "continuing contract" (the CC equivalent to tenure) uncomplicated and not stressful. Do your job, don't screw up and you'll be fine.Very high rankings in degree and and online programs. Most really care. Nice, clean classrooms, good technology integration and IT help. Generous professional development support.
cons: Student work ethic can be frustrating - although always at least a few bright lights (probably par for the course at CC's). School location is remote and the town is not very attractive. However, if you like the outdoors and natural beauty, these are only a stone's throw away.

pros: Advance yet small enough where each student can get the experience, attention, and assistance they need to succeed.
cons: The remoteness of the school, possibly.
